thread.title: UMass vs. Toledo: Minutemen an early two-touchdown home underdog to top-25 Rockets
thread.title_full: UMass vs. Toledo: Minutemen an early two-touchdown home underdog to top-25 Rockets

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass vs. Toledo: Minutemen an early two-touchdown home underdog to top-25 Rockets
text:
Comments 
File this under "not surprising at all." 
A day after dropping a 15-10 decision at home to an underwhelming Kent State team in a game in which it was favored by a touchdown, the University of Massachusetts football team finds itself a multiple-score underdog this week against No. 19 Toledo. 
According to betting website VegasInsider.com , the Minutemen opened the week as 9.5-point dog but the line has already moved quickly, growing to 14 points in just a few hours. 
UMass is 2-4 against the spread this season after losing to Kent State. 
Toledo, which has been ranked in the Associated Press top 25 poll for several weeks, comes into the game with a perfect 6-0 (3-0 Mid-American Conference) record. The Rockets demolished Eastern Michigan last week, 63-20, and also boast wins over No. 18 Arkansas and Iowa State. 
They beat Kent State, which gave UMass so much trouble over the weekend, by a convincing 38-7 margin. 
The Minutemen lost on the road to Toledo last year, 42-35, electing to let the Rockets score the go-ahead touchdown late in the fourth quarter in hopes of getting the ball back with enough time left on the clock to force overtime. 
Saturday's game kicks off at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough at 3 p.m. and will be broadcast online via ESPN3/WatchESPN. 
Follow MassLive.com UMass beat writer @Daniel_Malone on Twitter or reach him via email .
